div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Pllication of Chin Wah Hing, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Chin Doe Tung} No. 3378 RETURN.

TO THE HONORABLE JEREMIAH NETERER, JUDGE OF THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON: Now comes the respondent, John H. Sargent, United States acting Commisioner of Immigration at the port of Seattle, and for answer to the writ of heabeas corpus herein, says that he here produces the body of the sadi Chin Doe Tung, the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction thereof, and for further return and answer to said writ, here avers that he detained in his custody the body of the said Chin Doe Tung for deportation from the United States, as an alien and Chinese person not entitled to admission under the laws of the United States, under and by virtue ofan order of the Secretary of Labor of the United States, issued to him, said respondent, on June 29, 1916, which said order is in words and figures following, that is to say:
DEPARTMENT OF LABOR BUREAU OF IMMIGRATION WASHINGTON
In Answering Refer to No.54085/129 June 29, 1916.

Commissioner of Immigration, Seattle, Washington. The Bureau acknowledges the reciept of your letter of the 17th instant, No.33904, transmitting record on appeal in the case of Chin Doe Tung, applicant for admission as the minor son of a merchant.

After carefully considering the evidenc presented in the record, the Secretary has affirmed your
excluding decision on the ground that the claimed relationship is not established.

It is noted the examining inspeteor states that two white witnesses qualified, but the record contains the testimony of only one, a policeman. The Bureau desires that you forward a copy of the statement of the other witness, if there was one. Your exhibits are returned herewith. Alfred Hampton, AES Assistant Commissioner-General. Inc. 3199(1)
Repondent attaches hereto the record, decision and exhibits, both on the hearing before said Commissioner and on appeal to the Secretary of Labor, which constitute a part of this return.
And now the respondent having fully answered, prays that the said writ may be discharged, and the he may be awarded his costs about his return to the writ aforesaid in this behalf expended.
John H. Sargent Acting Commissioner of Immigration.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION}ss.

John H. Sargent being first duly sworn upon his oath deposes and says: That he isthe Acting Commissioner of Immigration named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return, knows the contents hereof and believes the same to be true.
John H. Sargent Subscribed and sworn to before me this 15th day of July, 1916. William S. Martin Notary Public in and for the State of Washington residing in Seattle
